actionUnits.condition: Verify SteamAudioSource MonoBehaviour (id 112451389, guid 59c3684b22f00604a97bb68037fcf4cd) is attached and responsive; safe no-arg public call.

Scene MonoBehaviour id 112451392 (guid 77f9a59041a2de446bf7704b5c31f103) matches FireBasedAudioManager with config: fireLimit=10, timeInterval=25. Test conditional event: external fire system should call IFireDependant.NotifyFireChange(int) with values both below (e.g., 0) and at/above limit (e.g., 10) to toggle shouldPlay. Note: NotifyFireChange has an int parameter and cannot be invoked via a no-arg Trigger; this step documents the event we need to trigger via the appropriate manager/UnityEvent.

MonoBehaviour component for CardboardStartup attached in GameScene.unity. MonoBehaviour component id=1678975687 on GameObject fileID=1678975683 uses script guid=77f9a59041a2de446bf7704b5c31f103 (FireBasedAudioManager). Serialized config: audioSource=fileID 0 (assigned via GetComponent in Awake), fireLimit=5, timeInterval=30. No m_Calls UnityEvents are defined; the script exposes no public no-arg methods to trigger manually. Behavior: Awake sets shouldPlay=true; Update will call audioSource.Play() once lastPlayed >= timeInterval, then repeat every 30s while shouldPlay remains true.

Manually exercise runtime reinitialization for SteamAudioManager (MonoBehaviour id=1695945195, script guid=b11066ff95bbf3344b868394742f7002). Current serialized config: currentHRTF=0, hrtfNames=[]. Expected: simulation thread restarted, devices (Embree/OpenCL/RadeonRays/TAN) re-validated, AudioEngineState reinitialized.

Explicitly test shutdown path for SteamAudioManager to validate cleanup of simulation thread, devices, HRTFs, and context. This event is not triggered automatically in normal play; use for teardown verification.

Manual trigger of audio source simulation update based on SteamAudioSource MonoBehaviour (script_fileID: 11500000, GUID: 59c3684b22f00604a97bb68037fcf4cd) with serialized properties: distanceAttenuation=1, distanceAttenuationInput=PhysicsBased, airAbsorption=1, occlusion=1. This is to test simulation flag processing and output updating when events from m_Calls are not automatically fired.

MonoBehaviour id=1921583764 on GameObject fileID=1406595866 uses script guid=ec977d61dc6bcaa4b851caa19dbd2ab0 (HoseController). Scene config: hoseHandle=1917998009, hoseWaterPs=921683140, audioSource resolved via GetComponent, hoseAudioStart guid=5f9e1ec2926171148b4eb76e35a4160b, hoseAudioDuring guid=ef708c36b889d174b8a4dde4a456d1f0, waterDelayTime=0.4, changeStateInterval=2. No UnityEvent m_Calls configured. Preconditions: IsValidChange()==true (lastChangeState>=2; initially true), hoseHandle.getIsTurning()==false, and ActionMapper.GetDevicesTrigger()==true. Expected: toggle hoseIsOn->true, hoseHandle.ActivateHandleMovement(true), audio start clip then during clip, water plays after 0.4s.

Second input press to toggle off. Preconditions: lastChangeState>=2 (after wait), hoseHandle.getIsTurning()==false, ActionMapper.GetDevicesTrigger()==true. Expected: toggle hoseIsOn->false, hoseHandle.ActivateHandleMovement(false), water stops after 0.4s delay, audio fades out over ~0.7s.
